Job Title: Technical Program Manager

Location: Arlington, VA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Administrative, Consulting, Project Management

Description:
What We Need 
Telesat is at the forefront of a satellite industry metamorphosis and is building and launching Telesat Lightspeed, our revolutionary Low Earth Orbit (LEO) satellite network, which is scheduled to launch in 2026 and begin service in 2027. Lightspeed will revolutionize global broadband connectivity for commercial and government enterprise users by delivering a combination of high capacity, secure, resilient, affordable, and low latency service, with fiber-like connectivity and speeds.
Telesat Government Solutions (TGS) is the United States (US) mitigated entity that interfaces directly with the US Government (USG) and manages a number of programs that will lead to adoption of Telesat’s Lightspeed connectivity services and develop technology understanding that will provide insights about satellite technology and capabilities that will enhance our capability to serve USG users.
To support our USG customers, TGS manages a number of programs that will lead to adoption of Telesat’s Lightspeed connectivity services and develop technology understanding that will provide insights about satellite technology and capabilities that will enhance our capability to serve USG users.
TGS is seeking a seasoned Technical Program Manager (PM) to lead our efforts to take these studies and projects to conclusion and to drive the capture of new programs.
Position Responsibilities 
Responsibility for day-to-day execution of one or multiple programs and studies based on size and complexity. This includes managing internal resources within TGS and the parent company, as well as coordinating teaming partners and vendors to ensure contract and program deliverables are achieved within the scope of the program. Understanding of key user communities needs and cultures is critical to success, particularly in translating requirements into realistic solutions and deliverables in furtherance of program objectives.Identifying, winning, and supporting new programs that develop greater Lightspeed awareness within the USG, and that -lead to the adoption of its new technology, capabilities or service platforms that will meet USG mission requirements.PM will be a senior member of the TGS leadership team to help create a culture of collaboration and inclusiveness and keep the focus on the strategic priorities of the customer and TGS.The candidate must have a win-win mentality – the ability to find the most beneficial solution to challenges for all stakeholders. The candidate will be responsible for all technical, business, project functions and for managing all program costs, schedule and deliverables.Day to day duties will include briefing all levels of the TGS and parent organization as well as external briefs to customers and various government agencies.
Required Applicant Education, Experience, & Skills 
U.S. Citizenship status is necessary as this position will require an active U.S. TOP SECRET/SCISecurity ClearanceThis position will be based out of the TGS office in Arlington, VA10+ years of professional work experience in managing complex systems programs, demonstrations and studies or other relevant experience.Strong written and verbal communication skills, with experience working with and making presentations to government customers and senior leadershipMust have deep knowledge of program management. Advanced knowledge of related disciplines within work area and ability to identify linkages and potential impact on projects, programs, or systems.Experience in leading competitive and sole source proposals and to lead capture strategy and proposal efforts and Risk management experienceExperience serving DoD customers as a collaborative partner, with extensive knowledge of DoD research laboratories, Program Offices, Program Executive Offices and HQ’s staffs across differentServices and agencies. Prior military service in related space and telecom fields is highly desirable.Requires broad management and leadership knowledge to lead project teamsMust be a self-starter with the ability to multi-task, address multiple issues and set prioritiesMust be reliable organized, flexible and detail orientedAbility to monitor, interact and course correct technical and project teams to support evolving customer requirementsExcellent business sense to proactively identify and resolve problems and issues quickly and efficientlyDemonstrated ability to initiate and sustain positive customer relationshipsDeep and recent successful experience with NASA and DoD Research LaboratoriesDemonstrated experience leading development programs including spiral upgrades to existing hardware and software systems and Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) experienceExperience in Competitive Captures and New Business DevelopmentSatellite manufacturing, satellite operations or satellite terminal technology knowledgeCurrent Top Secret / SCI Clearance is highly desired
Preferred Education 
A bachelor’s degree in engineering or a related technical discipline and a minimum of 12 years’ prior relevant experience; an advanced degree in a technical or related field and minimum10 years’ experience Engineering/Other Technical Positions is highly desirable
TGS takes pride in being an equal opportunity employer that values diversity in the workplace. Qualified applicants will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, color, religion, genetic information, marital status, ancestry, national origin, protected veteran status, physical disability, medical condition, mental disability, or disability status and any other characteristic protected by state or federal law. We are committed to providing the best candidate experience possible including any required accommodations at every stage of our interview process. All qualified applicants that have been selected for an interview that require accommodations, are advised to inform the Telesat Talent team accordingly. We will work with you to meet your needs. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential. 
About Telesat 
Backed by a legacy of engineering excellence, reliability, and industry-leading customer service, Telesat is one of the largest and most successful global satellite operators. Telesat works collaboratively with its customers to deliver critical connectivity solutions that tackle the world’s most complex communications challenges, providing powerful advantages that improve their operations and drive profitable growth.
Continuously innovating to meet the connectivity demands of the future, Telesat Lightspeed, the company’s LEO satellite network, will be the first and only LEO network optimized to meet the rigorous requirements of telecom, government, maritime and aeronautical customers. Operating under its international priority Ka-band spectrum rights, Telesat Lightspeed will redefine global satellite connectivity with ubiquitous, affordable, high-capacity links with fibre-like speeds.Publicly traded since 2021 and headquartered in Ottawa, Canada with offices and facilities around the world, Telesat’s principal shareholders are Canada’s Public Sector Pension Investment Board and Loral Space & Communications Inc. (NASDAQ: LORL).About Telesat Government Solutions
Telesat Government Solutions (TGS) is a wholly owned subsidiary of Telesat Canada, based in Arlington, VA with responsibility to take all Telesat’s products to US and foreign Government customers, to devise solutions to fit user community requirements and needs, to ensure that Telesat’s products are fit-for-purpose, and to prepare a scalable organization to meet the needs of delivering on Lightspeed’s promised service levels

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
